name: Open Foris Collect
description: Open Foris Collect is the main entry point for data collected in field-based inventories. It provides a fast, easy, flexible way to set up a survey with a user-friendly interface. Collect handles multiple data types and complex validation rules, all in a multilanguage environment.

SDGs.evidenceText:
FAO has a long history in supporting countries on national forest monitoring and has developed a suite of open source tools under the Open Foris initiative (http://www.openforis.org/). By January 2021, total of 25 countries have used OF Collect in their National Forest Inventory (NFI) for collecting field data. 
OF Collect has been used in Chad for woodfuel assessment in areas surrounding to the refugee camps, and OF Collect Mobile has been used to gather transaction data and thus to ensure food supply in rural Bangladesh.  In addition, OF tools are used for example for socio-economic inventory in Mongolia and dairy industry survey in Kazakhstan. 
 Of the 50 countries that have submitted a FREL/FRL submission to the UNFCCC, 56% has used OF Collect to collect and manage data from their forest inventory.

organizations.name: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations

privacyComplianceList: The user is responsible to abide by the national rules where the software is installed. Open Foris is developed within FAO (a UN organization) so we are not covered by national laws.
adherenceSteps: Open Foris is developed within FAO (a UN organization) so we are not covered by national laws.

standardsList: Security - HTTPS (Ready/depends on environment where Collect is installed)
Software Architectural Styles - REST (Representational State Transfer)
Data Exchange formats - JSON (JavaScript Object Notation), XML (Extensible Markup Language), CSV (Comma Separated Values)

Multimedia - PNG (Portable Network Graphics), JPEG (Joint Photographic Experts Group), Ogg MP3 (Moving Picture Experts Group: Audio Layer III), FLAC (Free Lossless Audio Codec), H.264 (H.264/MPEG-4 AVC), AAC (Advanced Audio Coding), MP4 (MPEG-4 Part 14)
bestPracticesList: Software Engineering - Agile development, Test driven development, Rapid application development
Architectural Design - Modularity and Maintainability, Reusability and Extensibility, Security & Consented Access, Universal Access & Open APIs

Best practices to help secure your IT resources: Enable resource access authorization i.e. access control rights/ permissions; Protect data in transit (SSL used depending on the instance where Open Foris Collect is installed)

preventHarm.additionalInfoMechanismProcessesPolicies: The project itself shares no data. It is the responsibility of the users to store data adequately as Open Foris Collect runs on servers controlled by them and they design their own databases.

dataPrivacySecurity.privacySecurityDescription:
The data collected is stored in a database that is the responsibility of the user that installs Collect. 
Collect uses a user-management procedure to assign passwords as well as user groups to access specific segments of the data.
